meanings.definition: A red protein responsible for transporting oxygen in the blood.
meanings.sent1: Hemoglobin helps carry oxygen in the blood.
meanings.sent2: Doctors can check your hemoglobin levels to see if you are healthy.
meanings.sent3: The hemoglobin in the blood was so busy carrying oxygen, it forgot to take a break!
meanings.sent4: Her love for running was like hemoglobin, always fueling her with energy.
meanings.sent5: The image of hemoglobin carrying oxygen is like a superhero saving the day.

meanings.definition: The iron-containing pigment in red blood cells that carries oxygen to the tissues.
meanings.sent1: Red blood cells contain hemoglobin that carries oxygen.
meanings.sent2: When hemoglobin binds with oxygen, it becomes bright red.
meanings.sent3: The hemoglobin in the red blood cells threw an oxygen party in the tissues!
meanings.sent4: His determination was as strong as the iron in hemoglobin, carrying him through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The sight of hemoglobin delivering oxygen is like a tiny magical journey inside us.
